When installing JRockit 3.1.3 (http://www.jrockit.com/download/) as JRE, and 
launching Java applications in Eclipse (stable build 20020214), Eclipse never 
understands that the JVM is launched. This worked well in the previous stable 
build. It also works well with older versions of JRockit.

The problems demonstrates itself in the following ways:
 * When pressing the "Running man" button, and starting the run wizard, after 
clicking Finish the following happens:
 - The program starts
 - The run wizard flashes briefly, but stays at the last page. Each press 
on "Finish" starts a new instance of the program.
 - The program does not show up in the debug view.

 * When relaunching a program from the Run History with the JRE set to JRockit 
3.1.3, the program starts, but it does not show up in the debug view.

JRockit 2.2, modifying it for JRockit 3.1.3, and running it with cmd.exe. That 
succeeded without problems, after I had "" around the command name due to 
spaces in the path, and changed from javaw.exe to java.exe for getting better 
feedback. (I've also tried renaming javaw.exe to force Eclipse to use java.exe -
- perhaps it should be possible to specify the executable more explicitly in

I have made some additional testing, to try to get JRockit running, since it is 
essential to our development. I tried to make the JRockit installation more and 
more equal to the Sun JRE by copying file after file from Sun. Finally, the 
whole JRockit JRE was identical to Sun's JRE, but Eclipse would still not run 
JRockit! I was amazed and confused.

Then I noted another difference. The Sun JRE was part of the Sun JDK, which the 
JRockit JRE wasn't. Copying the JRockit JRE over the Sun JRE in the Sun JDK 
directory solved the problem.

However, I was still a bit curious. I removed files and directories from the 
JDK to see how much I could remove and still be able to run JRockit. It seems 
as the following is needed, in a
directory one level above the JRE:
bin/java.exe
bin/javaw.exe
rt.jar

Further testing also confirmed that the same "disappear" problem occurs when 
running Sun's
stand-alone JRE (that which is not part of a JDK).

I could also confirm that this was not a problem in the previous stable build, 
so this is a new bug introduced somewhere between 20020125 and 20020214.

Even though I have found a work-around, I'd still like to see this bug fixed 
ASAP.

So this is what I just did:
I set up a 1.3.1 JRE that looked like
C:\Sun1.3.1JRE\jre
Under jre there is bin and lib (and 5 files: Changes, COPYRIGHT, License, 
README.txt and Welcome.html).
Added the JRE(Workbench-Preferences->Java->InstalledJREs->Add)
Set this JRE to be the Runtime JRE for a project

I then ran a InfiniteLoop program contained within the project.
The program did not show in the debug view.
The process was created (shows in the process monitor) but does not seem to be 
running.

This was on Build 20020305.

Thanks for the test case Magnus!

I have a workaround and a fix...our Java source locator was making assumptions 
on having a src.zip for a JRE if and only if the JRE is not set as the default 
JRE for the entire workspace (a project has been set to use a JRE different 
from the default).

So the temp workaround:
Set JRockit to the default JRE for the workspace.
Fixed released for JavaSourceLocator.
